column1: '''''nâla''''' is a [[Khuzdul]] word. In one instance [[J.R.R. Tolkien
column2: Tolkien]] translates ''nâla'' as "channel".<ref>[[J.R.R. Tolkien]], [[Nancy Smith]], "[[Index questions]]" (quoted in {{HM
column3: RC}}, p. 269)</ref> Later he would say that the meaning is unknown but suggested that it might mean "path, course, rivercourse, or bed", a meaning it would share with [[Sindarin]] ''[[rant]]'' of ''[[Celebrant]]''.<ref>{{HM
